org.taverna.server.master.worker

Class SecurityContextDelegate

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.taverna.server.master.worker.SecurityContextDelegate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TavernaSecurityContext

    public abstract class SecurityContextDelegate
extends Object
implements TavernaSecurityContext
    Implementation of a security context.
    Author:
    Donal Fellows

      • validateCredential

        public abstract void validateCredential(Credential c)
                                 throws InvalidCredentialException
        Description copied from interface: TavernaSecurityContext
        Tests if the credential is valid. This includes testing whether the underlying credential file exists and can be unlocked by the password in the Credential object.
        Specified by:
        validateCredential in interface TavernaSecurityContext
        Parameters:
        c - The credential object to validate.
        Throws:
        InvalidCredentialException - If it is invalid.

      • validateTrusted

        public void validateTrusted(Trust t)
                     throws InvalidCredentialException
        Description copied from interface: TavernaSecurityContext
        Tests if the trusted identity descriptor is valid. This includes checking whether the underlying trusted identity file exists.
        Specified by:
        validateTrusted in interface TavernaSecurityContext
        Parameters:
        t - The trusted identity descriptor to check.
        Throws:
        InvalidCredentialException - If it is invalid.

      • initializeSecurityFromContext

        public void initializeSecurityFromContext(org.springframework.security.core.context.SecurityContext securityContext)
                                   throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: TavernaSecurityContext
        Establish the security context from how the owning workflow run was created. In particular, this gives an opportunity for boot-strapping things with any delegateable credentials.
        Specified by:
        initializeSecurityFromContext in interface TavernaSecurityContext
        Parameters:
        securityContext - The security context associated with the request that caused the workflow to be created.
        Throws:
        Exception - If anything goes wrong.

      • conveySecurity

        public final void conveySecurity()
                          throws GeneralSecurityException,
                                 IOException,
                                 ImplementationException
        Builds and transfers a keystore with suitable credentials to the back-end workflow execution engine.
        Specified by:
        conveySecurity in interface TavernaSecurityContext
        Throws:
        GeneralSecurityException - If the manipulation of the keystore, keys or certificates fails.
        IOException - If there are problems building the data (should not happen).
        RemoteException - If the conveyancing fails.
        ImplementationException - If the local worker has problems with creating the realized security context.

      • conveyExtraSecuritySettings

        protected void conveyExtraSecuritySettings(RemoteSecurityContext remoteSecurityContext)
                                    throws IOException
        Hook that allows additional information to be conveyed to the remote run.
        Parameters:
        remoteSecurityContext - The remote resource that information would be passed to.
        Throws:
        IOException - If anything goes wrong with the communication.

      • generateNewPassword

        protected final char[] generateNewPassword()
        Returns:
        A new password with a reasonable level of randomness.

        public Set<String> getPermittedDestroyers()
